meanings.definition: Make (something) widely known or available to the public.
meanings.sent1: The local bakery publicized their new cake flavors through flyers.
meanings.sent2: The company publicized their upcoming sale on social media.
meanings.sent3: The magician publicized his disappearing act, but everyone saw how he did it.
meanings.sent4: The artist publicized her unique painting style, capturing the attention of art enthusiasts.
meanings.sent5: The teacher publicized the science fair, encouraging students to participate and showcase their projects.

meanings.sent1: The restaurant publicized their special menu for Valentine's Day.
meanings.sent2: The movie studio publicized their latest blockbuster with billboards and trailers.
meanings.sent3: The clown publicized his comedy show, promising endless laughter for all.
meanings.sent4: The fashion brand publicized their new collection, setting trends in the industry.
meanings.sent5: The bookstore publicized the author's book signing event, drawing in book lovers from all around.
